intro: Piqueria artemisioides, commonly known as the Mexican thistle, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as hairy leaves and a deep root system to conserve water. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in the spring, and it produces achenes with pappus for wind dispersal. Piqueria artemisioides is often considered a weed in agricultural areas due to its aggressive growth and ability to colonize disturbed soils.
